description: To carry out tree surgery including the cutting back of overhanging branches to the shared boundary line to One Horse Chestnut and one Conifer both within Woodland 1 on TPO 738
decision_conditions: The Horse Chestnut and Conifer are situated to the rear of 61 Dene Road within a woodland. The Chestnut can be seen from the Dene Road as well as Woodlea Grove and as a result has a Moderate to High amenity value. Both trees significantly contribute to the arboreal character of Dene Road, Northwood an Area of Special Local Character. The Conifer has a Moderate amenity value as part of the woods as a whole.

It is unclear as to exactly how much pruning the applicant wishes to carry out. As both trees are situated close to the properties boundary line they do overhang the rear garden of 61 Dene Road to some extent. However excessive removal of branches especially to the Horse Chestnut would lead to a lopsided crown. The applicant has mentioned it is unsafe for children to use the part of the garden under the trees however they have ticked no to question 8.1 "condition of the tree" and no Arboricultural evidence has been provided to support this claim. The pruning of the conifer branches touching the shed roof to provide 0.5m clearance to abate a nuisance. This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
